result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard A. Thompson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard A. Thompson was found guilty of Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Richard A. Thompson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Def is to report on or before January 5, 2016 between 6 & 7 a.m.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

ADDRESS INFO for Richard A. Thompson
Current: 356 E Court St, Apt 4, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 11-11-2015)
Prior: 356 E. Court Street #4, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Richard A. Thompson in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire submitted and plea agreement recited. Colloquy. NC pleas entered to count 2 & 3. Finding of guilty. 

Sentencing: 

Cts 2 and 3: 45 days jail. Pay costs of action, DNA sample and surcharge. Def is to report on or before January 5, 2016 between 6 & 7 a.m.

Defendant Richard A. Thompson in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. W states that the parties are at an impasse with negotiations; not certain if def wants court trial or jury trial.  Court sets 11/6 at 11:30 for status.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance. Defendant is not to enter into any bars/taverns or establishment where the sale of alcohol is the primary business.

AMENDED: No contact with Adam Giddings. No contact with 975 W. Seminary is lifted.

Defendant Richard A. Thompson in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Further status requested and set. Atty Whitney requests modification of bond conditions.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard A. Thompson in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel asks for adj. to 9/16.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Richard A. Thompson in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel asks for reset; need time to work on offer.  NG pleas entered.  Status set.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Richard A. Thompson in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states charges and informs def of his rights including right to counsel.  Matter reset to July 1 at 10.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
